message: The project provides a JVM implementation ontop of the vmkit. Project site: http://vmkit.llvm.org/

@alex Yep, they added a CLI/CLR implementation. It'd be great to see research along these lines continue. On page two, the authors write that "Out of the roughly 500,000 lines of code, only 4% (20,000 lines of code) are devoted to implementing the high level MRE, while the remaining 96% are provided by the substrate." It's pretty cool that their implementation of VMKit is both complete and generic enough to enable new languages / runtimes to be built on top of it without a truly heroic / well-funded effort.
doesn't it also do a CLR one?
And there's also a paper on a concept for OSGi component isolation with it -> http://pagesperso-systeme.lip6.fr/Nicolas.Geoffray/files/ijvm.pdf
@alex could be I stumbled upon it through the I-JVM paper so the JVM aspect was interesting to me.
Sorry, I meant VMKit includes the MMTk, not PyPy.
For comparison all of PyPy including: CPython stdlib, stdlib modules, interpreter, core datastructures, tests, RPython translator, and JIT come to 1.2Million
670KLOC of that is the CPython stdlib though
right I know what you meant :)
They include Jikes's MMTk.  That's not small, either.
PyPy is partially inspired by Jikes so that's cool
